discussion.content:

VMware Site Recovery Manager™ can be utilized with vSAN and vSphere Replication to orchestrate the recovery of multiple virtual machines.

Site Recovery Manager automates the failover and fail-back processes between the stretched cluster and the disaster recovery site.

questions.question_text:
An administrator is patching a production Stretched Cluster using VMware Update Manager.
Which statement is accurate?

discussion.content:
A is correct
Updating or Upgrading the vSAN Witness Appliance 

The vSAN Witness Appliance can easily be maintained/patched using vSphere Update Manager in the same fashion as traditional ESXi hosts.
It is not required to deploy a new vSAN Witness Appliance when updating or patching vSAN hosts. Normal upgrade mechanisms are supported on the vSAN Witness Appliance.
Note: When using an OEM provided vSphere ISO for upgrading vSAN hosts it is important to remember that additional OEM specific drivers or software may be included. It is important to use only a VMware provided vSphere ISO to upgrade the vSAN Witness Appliance.

https://core.vmware.com/resource/vsan-stretched-cluster-guide#sec7306-sub2
I think A is correct, a witness host is a standard host.

choices.C: The witness host does not need to be upgraded as there is no data on the node, just metadata.
choices.A: The witness hosts can be patched using normal patch processes with VMware Update Manager.
choices.D: The witness host must be deleted and a new witness host must be deployed.
choices.B: Witness hosts cannot be patched or upgraded using VMware Update Manager.
